document.docOrigin: Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History 2000 (245)
document.masterDocTitle: A Relimitation And Revision Of The Australasian Ground Spider Family Lamponidae (Araneae: Gnaphosoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Relimitation And Revision Of The Australasian Ground Spider Family Lamponidae (Araneae: Gnaphosoidea)
Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History

subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPES: Female holotype and male allotype taken in pitfall traps at an elevation of
385 m
on
Allyn River Forest
Road
,
500 m
S Mount Allyn Road , Chichester State Forest , 328099S, 1518289E, New South Wales (
Feb. 4–Apr. 9, 1993
; M. Gray , G. Cassis ), deposited in AMS ( KS37356 )
.
ETYMOLOGY: The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality.

DIAGNOSIS: This species resembles
G. bruxner
but can be distinguished by the sharp point on the retrolateral side of the median apophysis in males (fig. 558) and the closely spaced, anteriorly situated epigynal openings of females (fig. 560).

MALE: Total length 5.1. Coloration as in
G. bruxner
. Leg spination: tibiae: III v0­1p­ 2, r0­0­0; IV v2­1p­2; metatarsi IV p0­1­0. Retrolateral tibial apophysis not bifid, with ventral edge ledge­shaped (fig. 559); median apophysis with twisted tip originating from sharp point on retrolateral side (fig. 558).

FEMALE: Total length 4.9. Coloration as in male. Leg spination: femur I d0­0­0; tibiae: III v0­1p­2, r0­0­1; IV v1p­1p­2; metatarsi IV p0­1­0. Epigynal openings situated anteriorly, closely spaced (fig. 560); spermathecae sharply angled (fig. 561).

caption.paragraph:
Map 66. Records of
Graycassis chichester
, new species (squares),
Asadipus auld
, new species (circles), and
A. humptydoo
, new species (triangles).

Figs. 562–565.
Graycassis barrington
, new species . 562. Left male palp, ventral view. 563. Same, retrolateral view. 564. Epigynum, ventral view. 565. Same, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: New South Wales and adjacent Queensland (map 66).
